raw_mentions:
D-9Rac/am (SEQ ID NO. 15) showed a K<sub>i(app)</sub>=170 nM compared to K<sub>i(app)</sub>=370 nM for L-Bel1 and to Ki=1 nM for FI-I (CALBIOCHEM).
Thus while 0.7 μM of D-9Rac/am is sufficient to fully block the cleavage of Boc-RVRR-CMA by furin (FIG. 5A), L-Bel1 and L-9K required a higher amount (3.5 μM and >3.5 μM respectively) for complete blockade of this cleavage (FIGS. 5B and 5C). 
As demonstrated in FIG. 4B the basic peptides including D-9Rac/am (SEQ ID NO. 15), D-6R (SEQ ID NO. 19), and L-Bel1 (SEQ ID NO. 3) inhibited to completion in vitro furin activity (K<sub>i </sub>in nM) when compared against Boc-RVRR-MCA as substrate.
